FuncDef:
The dns-url permit command configures a whitelist for users who access web services using HTTPS.
The undo dns-url permit command deletes a whitelist configured for users who access web services using HTTPS.
By default, no whitelist is configured for users who access web services using HTTPS.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a webpage address.
The value is a string of 1 to 200 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When users access web services using HTTPS and a list of accessible domain names or IP addresses for a pre-authentication domain needs to be configured, run the dns-url permit command to configure a whitelist, so that packets that match the whitelist are sent to the CPU.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
After the function to redirect DNS packets to a web server address is enabled, the blacklist function becomes invalid.
